{"step_by_step_thinking": "An impacted tooth is a tooth that gets blocked as it is pushing through the gum into your mouth. To remove an impacted tooth, a dentist needs to see the exact position of the tooth and its relation to the surrounding structures. A periapical film is a type of intraoral X-ray that shows the entire tooth from the crown to the root where the tooth attaches into the jaw. It can show any unusual changes in the root and surrounding bone structures. Therefore, it is the most suitable type of radiograph for this procedure.", "answer_choice": "A"}
